## Managing the data

```{r}
test <- testing[,colSums(is.na(testing)) == 0] 
examen <- testing[,names(test)]
iguales <- (names(training) == names(examen))
datos <- training[iguales]
evaluacion <- testing[iguales]
```

## Making the model

```{r}
inTrain <- createDataPartition(y=datos$problem_id, p = 0.75, list = FALSE)
entreno <- datos[inTrain,]
testeo <- datos[-inTrain,]
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=TRUE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
